world_building: NDE patient registry exists - NeuroTech has scanned 247 cardiac arrest survivors in 18 months
Sarah can request follow-up scans under pretense of routine monitoring
Janet signs off on research requests without close reading if they sound boring enough
QMRI has been standard practice for 5 years, yet no published research on this phenomenon exists
Other hospitals exist in network (Portland, Vancouver) for multi-site research
Standard intake protocols for post-NDE cognitive assessment
phenomenon_details: Pattern is consistent: NDE survivors with 4+ minutes clinical death return quantum noise on QMRI
All show subtle precognition (seconds to minutes ahead, unconscious process)
All describe it similarly: probability clouds, seeing ahead, being out of sync with linear time
Patients with neurological damage from oxygen deprivation DON'T show the phenomenon
Death must take them 'right to the edge' but release them intact for the change to occur
Phenomenon is reproducible across different patients, hospitals, equipment
All patients were afraid to mention their precognition (sounds crazy/delusional)
sarah_methodology: Hides research in plain sight: embeds revolutionary work inside boring calibration procedures
Creates encrypted files with innocuous names (QMRI Calibration, Baseline Noise Characterization)
Meets patients off-hours in casual locations to avoid institutional attention
Cross-references NDE survivors with specific criteria to predict who will show phenomenon
Has refined screening criteria based on death duration and recovery quality
Backs up files to multiple drives in different locations
escalating_interference: Sarah experiencing odd setbacks: grants rejected with mismatched feedback, peer review of unsubmitted paper, computer crashes
Marcus senses 'timeline static' when trying to look at Sarah's future - new interference
Marcus feels 'ontological pressure' from entity that 'manages multiple branches at once'
Something is 'paying attention' to Sarah's research specifically
This attention is recent - correlates with her expanding investigation
character_development: Sarah is splitting into multiple versions: public researcher vs hidden revolutionary vs uncertain self-doubter
Isolation of secrecy is crushing her - wants to tell David but imagines his dismissal
She's violating ethics protocols but convinced it's necessary
Marcus has protective 'big brother' relationship with Sarah
Sarah's pattern-recognition instinct is stronger than her need for institutional approval
She's choosing her conviction over systemic validation - major character growth
